data.title: Fun tour
data.text: Nice tour of the State Capital, learned a lot about our State Government. Beautiful building, would recommend visiting.

data.title: Tremendously Beautiful!
data.text:
The State Capitol was restored about 20 years ago.  Many criticized the expenditure, but were not critical with the results.

The original craftsmanship, now in full view, is breathtaking!  The woodwork, is stunning.  Using the State flag as the inspiration, the chandlers have detailed carved replicas of the White Tailed Deer, arranged in a beautiful profile.
The walls have intricate painted patterns in blues, greens, gold.
There's stained glass throughout the chambers and the coffered ceilings of both the Senate and House chambers are stained glass replicas of all the flags of all the States.
You can walk up several floors almost to the top of the Rotunda where there are more stunning murals.
The list goes on and on.  It's truly a gem, a must see for visitors and residents alike.

data.title: Amazing!!
data.text: Such a wonder Fall walk down town! There is so much to see and do in Lansing. We stopped at local shops and Restaurants. Tons of Fun!!

data.title: Beautifully Restored
data.text: This is one of the best restoration projects in the United States!  I worked in the building before it was restored and can tell you how badly a building can be abused!!! Yeah restoration project in the 90s was a miracle!  Since that time, staff has treated this gem with great love and care.  Visit the Michigan Historical Museum about three blocks west while in downtown Lansing!

data.title: Senator for a day
data.text: We visited as my son was chosen as a senator for a day. Stand was very helpful. Our tour guide was friendly and easy to listen to. Overall a great day for a 3rd grade boy and his mom!

data.title: Good Tour
data.text: I've been visiting state capitols for a hobby.  This is a nice one to visit; my tour guide was quite knowledgeable.  The Senate was in session, so we didn't get much info in the chamber, but it was interesting to sit in the gallery and observe for a little while.  One downside--parking is not convenient.  Street parking is metered, and they only operate with coins.  (I wasn't prepared...I only had 65 cents in my pocket.)  There is a garage about 3 blocks away (although they don't accept cash).

data.title: Beautiful Capitol Interior
data.text: This building isn't much to look at from the outside, just a box with a small dome on top.  When you get inside it's a different story.  We joined a tour with a class of 3rd graders but our tour guide was excellent and very able to handle the kids.  We learned a lot that we wouldn't have gotten just wandering about on our own.  The interior is very elaborate, typical for a late-Victorian capitol building.  The interior of the dome is beautiful.

data.title: classic design
data.text: the bldg is filled with dated items like like fixtures and checkered stair cases and the carved wood work and the 5 story atrium

data.title: Must See
data.text: If you ever visit Lansing, this is a must see.  Incredibly well restored and maintained, if you live in Michigan and haven't visited the capitol, you're missing out.

data.title: Educational and fun to see!
data.text: This is a building everyone should see when they are in the mid Michigan area! You will be amazed at the workmanship that has been put in the building. The dome has freshly been painted, it is beautiful. The building materials are all from Michigan.

data.title: Great historic site in downtown Lansing
data.text: Lately the State Capitol complex has been buzzing with people, old and young alike, walking on the lawn and walkways, sitting on the steps, and looking at their phones. Pokemon Go's Poke stops are plentiful at this historic location. The building and grounds are immaculately maintained, as you would expect. Inside the building you can take self guided tours, or connect with a group that is taking a guided tour. The people guiding are brilliant, humorous, and great servants. The long and the tall of it is, this is a great place to visit. See you there!

data.title: The past comes to life.
data.text: Hadn't been to the capitol since grade school. It has been remodeled and the wallpaper and carpeting are beautiful. Took the steps to each floor and really got a good workout. There is also an elevator for the handicapped. History buffs will enjoy coming here.

data.title: A Very Nice Capitol
data.text: We've stopped in at quite a few state capitols over the years and Michigan's ranks near the top.  It's beautifully restored and there are a lot of different people who will take a few minutes to show you things.  The inside dome is extremely nice and the layout is less formal and more friendly than most.  Worth a few minutes.

data.title: a must see
data.text: The Capitol is the most beautiful  building in Michigan, and everyone who lives here should go and visit  and learn our history. The docents are very informative and helpful.

data.title: Nice visit
data.text: My husband, daughter and I enjoyed touring the capitol and seeing the building and all of the offices.

data.title: Living history
data.text: We had a great Saturday tour of the historic and beautifully restored State Capitol, a Victorian gem. Out tour guide, Brian, did a great job of making history come alive for us. And I love that the building is still where the Michigan Legislature still sits -- this is not a museum; this is truly living history.

data.title: Stately
data.text: This was a beautiful capitol building.  The State Trooper on duty was very polite and provided a lot of great historical information.  He was even kind enough to take a photo of our family on the capitol building steps!

data.title: Chinashop53
data.text: Excellent staff, friendly and no metal detector, unusual since most Capitals have them. Appearance much better since work has been done, found wood work and cleaner newer looking since last visit.

data.title: A really surprising, great experience
data.text: I went with my wife and 15-month old daughter for a free tour (we live in Lansing).  It was a really excellent one-hour tour of the building.  The tour guide was great (even though she wasn't from Michigan), there was enough time to ask questions, and we weren't rushed.  We wandered off at the end and a police officer found us and gave us a mini behind-the-scenes tour, which was amazing!  It's definitely worth a trip if you're in the area, whether you're a local or just visiting.

data.title: History at its finest
data.text: My dad is on a mission to visit every state capitol to honor his late brother; Michigan's State Capitol in Lansing did not disappoint.  When you walk in you are immediately greeted by the beauty of this historic building.  If you are in Lansing, you have to stop by the Capitol building, you have to.
